From which it appears that 
the fresh-boiled barometer 
stood .003 In. higher than the 
other which had been made 
18 months & was unfurnished 
with a guard.
The next comparison was
between the same barometer 
of Mr Newman, the Royal 
Society’s Standard, a fresh-boiled 
Mountain-barometer of Prof.
Schumacher and my barometer 
with the platinum ring
